intro: Bromus unioloides var. brevis, commonly known as the short-stemmed brome, is a perennial grass species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Its inflorescence consists of a single, dense spikelet at the tip of each stem, which produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. This variety is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for small organisms.
